title: 112_hr6659
content: The Urban Recovery and Growth Act, also known as the Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds Extension for Certain Cities, is an amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It extends economic development bonds for specific cities. The Urban Recovery and Growth Act extends economic development bonds for specific cities by treating them as qualified bonds issued before January 1, 2011, increasing the applicable percentage to 45%, and making interest on the bonds includible in gross income. The term 'bond' refers to a specified bond issued within a 1-year period with 100% of the excess project proceeds over required reserves to be used for qualified purposes, designated by the issuer. The term 'specified bond' refers to any obligation (excluding private activity bonds) where the interest would be tax-exempt under section 103, subject to similar rules as section 54AA(d)(2). The term 'qualified purposes' refers to any qualified economic development purpose as defined in section 1400U-2(c), when the excess described in paragraph (1)(A) is used for such purpose. Section 148 does not apply in this case. The term 'specified city' refers to any principal city for a metropolitan statistical area with an average unemployment rate. The specified city must meet specific criteria, including having an average unemployment rate at least 150 percent higher than the national average and a population loss of at least 20 percent between 2000 and 2010. There is a limitation on the amount of bonds that can be designated. The maximum aggregate face amount of bonds designated for a specified city is limited by the bond allocation based on the city's population proportion. The maximum aggregate face amount of bonds designated for a specified city is limited by the bond allocation based on the city's population proportion, as determined for the 2010 census. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for part III of subchapter Y of chapter 1 of the Code. Extension of recovery zone economic development bonds for certain cities, effective for obligations issued after the enactment of this Act.
